PageTitle: ipv6 route recursive-lookup arp vlink-direct-route protocol static
FuncDef:
The ipv6 route recursive-lookup arp vlink-direct-route protocol static command configures a device to recurse IPv6 static routes to ARP Vlink routes.
The undo ipv6 route recursive-lookup arp vlink-direct-route protocol static command disables a device from recursing IPv6 static routes to ARP Vlink routes.
By default, IPv6 static routes cannot recurse to ARP Vlink routes.
CLIs: ipv6 route recursive-lookup arp vlink-direct-route protocol static
undo ipv6 route recursive-lookup arp vlink-direct-route protocol static
Examples: [~HUAWEI] ipv6 route recursive-lookup arp vlink-direct-route protocol static
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a scenario where a Layer 2 VPN accesses a Layer 3 VPN, to configure a device to recurse static routes to ARP Vlink routes, run the ipv6 route-static command with recursive-lookup host-route specified and IPv6 route recursive-lookup arp vlink-direct-route protocol static.
If a Layer 2 link fails, for example, the physical interface of a Layer 2 device fails, traffic can be switched to the backup path immediately, preventing traffic loss caused by a black-hole route.
Precautions
After the ipv6 route recursive-lookup arp vlink-direct-route protocol static command is run, all IPv6 static routes can recurse to ARP Vlink routes. After the undo ipv6 route recursive-lookup arp vlink-direct-route protocol static command is run, IPv6 static routes cannot recurse to ARP Vlink routes.
